results.title: Night Cries: A Rural Tragedy
results.brief_description: Tracey Moffat’s artwork that acts as an unofficial sequel to Jedda and reframes the story through an Indigenous lens.
results.description: A short film about the relationship between an Aboriginal daughter and her white mother. The daughter, now the sole carer of her dying mother, dreams of far away places, the haunted look in her eyes loaded with a sense of what could have been. Famous Aboriginal singer, Jimmy Little, sings ‘Royal Telephone’, evoking the presence of Christianity and its role in the assimilation of Aboriginal people. The final scene sees the daughter lying in a foetal position next to her mother, crying. Assimilation, then, can be understood as a pain experienced by both the Aboriginal daughter as well as the white mother.
description_for_label: A short film about the relationship between an Aboriginal daughter and her white mother. The daughter, now the sole carer of her dying mother, dreams of far away places, the haunted look in her eyes loaded with a sense of what could have been. Famous Aboriginal singer, Jimmy Little, sings ‘Royal Telephone’, evoking the presence of Christianity and its role in the assimilation of Aboriginal people. The final scene sees the daughter lying in a foetal position next to her mother, crying. Assimilation, then, can be understood as a pain experienced by both the Aboriginal daughter as well as the white mother.

results.title: Neptune's Daughter
results.brief_description: The daughter of King Neptune takes on human form to avenge the death of her young sister, who was caught in a fishing net. However, she falls in love with the king, the man she holds responsible.

constellations_other.name: Film firsts
constellations_other.description: The early days of cinema were an exciting period of experimentation, with many inventors racing to come up with their own moving-image devices.

constellations_other.name: Ice Queens and Sirens of the sea
constellations_other.description: Sports stars and mythological creatures on-screen.

results.title: Neon Genesis Evangelion: The End of Evangelion
results.creator_credit: Masao Shibata, GAINAX, Movic, Star Child Recording, TV Tokyo, Production I.G, Kadokawa Shoten, Toei Company, SEGA, Mitsuhisa Ishikawa, Hideaki Anno, Kazuya Tsurumaki and Mitsuharu Haibara
results.brief_description: The second of two theatrically released follow-ups to the Neon Genesis Evangelion series about the battle between humanity and terrifying angels.

constellations_other.name: Evangelical animation
constellations_other.description: This Constellation exploring animation was created by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Melanie Kavanagh.

results.title_for_label: Neon Genesis Evangelion: The End of Evangelion
results.creator_credit_for_label: Masao Shibata, GAINAX, Movic, Star Child Recording, TV Tokyo, Production I.G, Kadokawa Shoten, Toei Company, SEGA, Mitsuhisa Ishikawa, Hideaki Anno, Kazuya Tsurumaki and Mitsuharu Haibara
results.description: The second of two theatrically released follow-ups to the Neon Genesis Evangelion series. Comprising of two alternate episodes which were first intended to take the place of episodes 25 and 26, this finale answers many of the questions surrounding the series, while also opening up some new possibilities.
description_for_label: The second of two theatrically released follow-ups to the Neon Genesis Evangelion series. Comprising of two alternate episodes which were first intended to take the place of episodes 25 and 26, this finale answers many of the questions surrounding the series, while also opening up some new possibilities.

results.title: Neon Genesis Evangelion
results.creator_credit: GAINAX, Hideaki Anno, Noriko Kobayashi and Yutaka Sugiyama
results.brief_description: At the turn of the century, the Angels returned to Earth, seeking to wipe out humanity in an apocalyptic fury. Mankind’s remnants retreated and bid their time, waiting to battle the Angels with bio-mechs known as Evangelions.
results.creator_credit_for_label: GAINAX, Hideaki Anno, Noriko Kobayashi and Yutaka Sugiyama
results.description: At the turn of the century, the Angels returned to Earth, seeking to wipe out humanity in an apocalyptic fury. Devastated, mankind’s last remnants moved underground to wait for the day when the Angels would come back to finish the job. Fifteen years later, that day has come… but this time, humanity is ready to fight back with terrifying bio-mechanical weapons known as the Evangelions. Watch as Shinji, Rei, Asuka and the rest of the mysterious shadow agency Nerv battle to save earth from total annihilation.
description_for_label: At the turn of the century, the Angels returned to Earth, seeking to wipe out humanity in an apocalyptic fury. Watch as Shinji, Rei, Asuka and the rest of the mysterious shadow agency Nerv battle to save earth from total annihilation.

results.title: Ned Kelly
results.headline_credit: Australia, France, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2003
results.brief_description: After getting threatened by Kelly’s friends and family, Constable Fitzpatrick places the blame on Ned Kelly and exaggerates what happened. With the biggest ever award available, Kelly and his gang set into the wild, to remain hidden from everyone who seeks them. Even if it means having his family arrested, the members of the Kelly Gang stay hidden and plan a way to get their names cleared.

results.title: NASA: 25 Years
results.headline_credit: Canada and United States of America, 1983
results.brief_description: A collection of NASA films, from Project Mercury to the Space Shuttle.

results.title: Mystery Road
results.creator_credit: Screen Australia, Mystery Road Films, Vanessa Loh, Ivan Sen, Matthew Putland and David Jowsey
results.headline_credit: Australia and United States of America, 2013
results.brief_description: A murdered girl is found under a bridge on a remote road and indigenous detective Jay Swan gets the case. Jay finds that no-one is that interested in solving the murder of an indigenous teenager and he is forced to work alone.

constellations_other.name: Rachel Perkins
constellations_other.description: The moving image has helped tell First Peoples stories through documentary, films and TV shows, with acclaimed director, producer and screenwriter Rachel Perkins contributing significantly to these stories.

results.title: Mystery Road
results.brief_description: When there is a mysterious disappearance on an outback cattle station, Detective Jay Swan is assigned to investigate. Working with local cop Emma James, Jay’s investigation uncovers a past injustice that threatens the fabric of the whole community.

constellations_other.name: Native Tongue
constellations_other.description: The lead single off her album of the same name, 'Native Tongue' saw artist Mo'Ju explore cultural identity through music, movement and striking visuals.

constellations_other.name: Australians on the world stage
constellations_other.description: George Miller’s Mad Max revolutionised movies when it tore through cinemas in 1979. Max Rockatansky’s journey dispensing justice across the wasteland in his V8 Interceptor became a cult classic and catapulted Australian cinema onto the world stage.

results.description: When there is a mysterious disappearance on an outback cattle station, Detective Jay Swan is assigned to investigate. Working with local cop Emma James, Jay’s investigation uncovers a past injustice that threatens the fabric of the whole community.

results.title: My So-Called Life
results.brief_description: The life of a 15 year-old high school student, whose angst-ridden journey through adolescence, friendship, parents, and life teaches her what it means to grow up.

constellations_other.name: Teens, zines and 90s scenes
constellations_other.description: Exploring representations of teen life and culture.

results.title: My Little Pony: The Movie
results.creator_credit: Lionsgate, DHX Media, Hasbro Studios, Allspark Pictures, Marcia Gwendolyn Jones, Rita Hsiao, Brian Goldner, Joe Ballarini, Stephen Davis, Meghan McCarthy, Jayson Thiessen, Michael Vogel and Haven Alexander
results.headline_credit: Canada and United States of America, 2017
results.brief_description: A new dark force threatens Ponyville, and the Mane 6 – Twilight Sparkle, Applejack, Rainbow Dash, Pinkie Pie, Fluttershy and Rarity – embark on an unforgettable journey beyond Equestria where they meet new friends and exciting challenges on a quest to use the magic of friendship and save their home.

constellations_other.name: Flipping through the evolution of animation
constellations_other.description: Animation has come a long way since flip books were popular. These optical toys gave the illusion of movement, but now whole films and special effects are animated entirely through computers.
